intro: Pilea smilacifolia var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated pilea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
